content.editContentTip: You can modify the displayed content ( #{step} ).
copy.copyCourseTip: Duplicate this course with a new name. BEWARE:The associated files are not copied!
courseDetail.noPermit: You are not allowed to see this content!
courseNavEdit.graphTip: (You can reload the graphic any number of times)
courseNavEdit.text.p1: In the table below, you see all of your created content blocks. You have to assign one or several successors to <u>every</u> content block (i.e. every table row). Fill in the number of the content block (see first column). That way, you set the display order of your content blocks.
courseNavEdit.text.p2: If you want content no. 1 be followed by content no. 4, you write in row 1, column 3 the number 4
courseNavEdit.text.p3:
Note, that Dialogs usually link to different blocks, depending of the answer.
In this case, fill in the numbers (plural) of the succeeding blocks, comma-separated:For example, 3, 4 means that the first answer leads to content block no. 3, while the second answer leads to content block no. 4.
courseNavEdit.title: Table of Contents

courseUpdate.modal.categoryHint: The combination of course title and category already exists! Please choose a new category or change the title!
courseUpdate.modal.titleHint: That course name already exists! Do you want to choose a new name?
courses.title: All courses

deleteCourse.modal.text: Are you sure that you want to delete the <u>entire</u> course?
footer.laya: The digital learning platform for inclusive learning
layaAbleplayer.caption: Include an AblePlayer video from link.
layaAbleplayer.name: Video via AblePlayer
layaAbleplayer.subtitle: Subtitles URL:
layaAbleplayer.tooltip:
In this component you can provide barrier-free films. We use AblePlayer.

You need the URL for the movie, which you can enter in the line 'Main Video URL'.

In addition, you can specify a URL where the video with sign language is stored.

The file for subtitles is referenced in the line 'Subtitle URL'.
layaHtml.caption: Insert free text without interaction (e.g. as last content block).
layaHtml.name: Free text
layaHtml.placeholder: Here you can enter a free text. This text does not allow any interaction of the participants. This component is therefore particularly suitable for giving an overview or providing information.
layaLaDragDrop.caption: This component allows to ask multiple choice questions.
layaLaDragDrop.name: Drag & Drop
layaLaDragDrop.tooltip:
In this component you can ask multiple choice questions. This serves as a quick learning check.

In the 'Title' line, enter the heading for the segment. You can also leave this line blank.

The line 'Question/Task' gives you space to formulate a work order. Line breaks can be defined with a backslash ('\').

In 'Voice Over' you store the address of the audio file that reads out the work order.

The 'Categories' indicate the selection options. You can add as many categories as you like via the blue button.

The 'Items' include the examples that your participants should assign to the correct category. Select the name and the correct answer options. Also here you can select as many items as you like via the blue button, with the red button you delete items.
layaLaFeedback.caption: This component allows you to get feedback for your course.
layaLaFeedback.name: Course Feedback
layaLaFeedback.prefetch.categories: Do not agree, Rather do not agree, Neutral, Rather agree, Agree
layaLaFeedback.prefetch.items: The course has a discernible structure., The course has interesting contents, The course difficulty was adequate., I did not feel underchallenged at any point., I did not feel overwhelmed at any point., The assessment blocks helped me understand., I would recommend this course to others.
layaLaFeedback.prefetch.task: This content block allows you to give feedback. Our goal is to make our courses as comprehesible and accessible as possible. Therefore, we kindly ask you to give your opinion about our content and conveyance. The feedback is given anonymously. If you agree to answer any question we might have about your feedback, please click the corresponding button.
layaLaFeedback.title: Course feedback
layaLaFeedback.tooltip:
In this component you can send feedback about the course. You can use several of these feedback components in a course.

In the 'Title' line, enter the heading for the Feedback. You can also leave this line blank.

The line 'Description' gives you the possibility to explain to participants what you are particularly interested in when giving feedback.

The feedback is divided into two parts:Closed questions and a free text. The closed questions are used to obtain an opinion. You can choose from various default options. By default there is a gradation from 'Agree' to 'Do not agree'. However, you can choose your own gradations. For this you can delete existing answers by clicking the red button.

You can add and remove questions at will. To do this, press the blue or red button under 'Questions'.
layaLaRelate.caption: This Component allows questions with a choice dropdown.
layaLaRelate.name: Relate
layaLaRelate.tooltip:
In this one you can ask your participants questions, in which an assignment must be made. To do this, set image or audio files. This component is suitable for the to train understanding of interrelationships.

In the line 'Title', enter the title for the task one. You can also leave this line blank, e.g. if this component is a part of a series of learning tests.

The line 'Question/Task' gives you space to formulate a work order. Line breaks can be defined with a backslash ('\').

In 'Voice over' you store the address of the audio file that reads out the work order.

In 'Solutions/Relationships' enter all possible answers. These will later be available for selection in the drop-down menu. You can add as many solutions as you like. To do this, use the blue button below the list of solutions. Individual solutions can be removed via the red button.

The 'Items' include the examples that your participants should be assigned to the correct category. You can enter a URL for an image and for a sound file. Select which of the answer options is correct. Here you can add as many items as you like via the blue button, with the red button you can delete items.
layaLaScmc.caption: Multiple Choice or Multiple Response Questions.
layaLaScmc.name: Multiple Choice / Multiple Response
layaLaScmc.tooltip:
With this component you can create a quiz. You have the choice between multiple choice and multiple response. A multiple choice question has only one possible answer, a multiple response question, on the other hand, several.

In the line 'Type' you choose which questions you ask would like:A question with one possible answer (Single Choice), or one with several correct answers (Multiple Choice).

The 'Title' line allows you to select a heading. You can also leave this line blank.

In the line 'Question/Task' you must enter the work order or the question.

In 'Voiceover' you store the address of the audio file that reads out the work order.

The 'Items' now include the answer options. You can select add as many answers as you like. Use the red button on the on the left side you can remove single answers. The blue button at the end adds one more answer possibility each time.

Don't forget to mark the correct answers with the check mark! The respective answer is then considered correct scores when the participants evaluate your quiz.
layaLaSort.caption: This component allows sorting questions (e.g. asking for order).
layaLaSort.name: Sort
layaLbDialog.caption: Allows adding jump labels to skip to certain parts of the course.
layaLbDialog.name: Dialog
layaLbDialog.tooltip:
This component allows you to create different paths through a course. You specify a task or question and define answers. In the course navigation, you can then select different follow-up content depending on the selected answer.

In the text field 'Task' you enter the task or question that you want your participants to answer.

The line for the background image allows you to specify the URL for a background image.

You can add as many answers as you like. Use the 'Add answer' button for this. With the red button to the right of the text field you can remove the answers.
layaLbPlyrVimeo.tooltip: With this component, you can insert a video from Vimeo. You only have to give the link to the video you want to insert. We provide a player that allows the video to be played within the course interface.
layaPlyr.caption: Include a video from Youtube or Vimeo.
layaPlyr.name: Youtube or Vimeo Video
layaPlyr.tooltip:
With this component, you can insert a video from two platforms, Youtube and Vimeo. You only have to give the link to the video you want to insert.

After input, we check if the video comes from one of the two supported platforms.

Afterwards, we provide a player that allows the video to be played within the course interface.
layaPlyr.wrongURL: Wrong URL! Please input a link to Youtube or Vimeo!
layaUploadFileList.deleteFileConfirm: Do you really want to delete this file?
layaUploadFileList.noFiles: There are currently no files in this Course!
layaUploadFileList.tooltip:
You can browse the files belonging to the course here. You can also upload new files.

When there are already files in your course, you see a list of files. It shows the file type as an icon. Then it shows the name of the file, followed by the size. The icon to copy allows you to copy the URL for the file. This is useful to paste it into Course Component forms. With the red button, you can delete files.

If you want to upload files, click on 'Upload Files'. You can now Drag & Drop files. By clicking 'Select Files', you can choose them from a popup window. Click 'Start Upload' to start the file upload. Any errors during the upload are indicated in the list of uploading files. Note that clicking the red button does not remove the file, but just clears it from the list.

Restrictions for upload:No duplicate files, no files larger than 500 MBytes, no executables.

root.promoText1: We offer lectures for trending topics like burnout and compliance for students with learning disabilities or sensory impairments.
root.promoText2: For students with audio-visual impairments we provide our content in a best-fit representation.
root.promoText3: Videos are accompanied by sign language.
root.promoText4: Our website is designed with assistive technologies in mind.
root.subtitle: the inclusive learning platform
root.title: Welcome to LAYA
